title: Particle Motion from velocity function part - c

content.description:
A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t is given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mfenced> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamODaiaacI cacaWG0bGaaiykaiabg2da9iabgkHiTiaacIcacaWG0bGaey4kaSIa aGymaiaacMcaciGGZbGaaiyAaiaac6gadaqadaqaamaalaaabaGaam iDamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaaaOqaaiaaikdaaaaacaGLOaGaayzk aaaaaa@463A@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> .

At time t = 0, the particle is at position x = 1.
content.question: Find the total distance traveled by the particle from time t = 0 until t = 3.

frqParts.text: Find the total distance traveled by the particle from time t = 0 until t = 3.

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
